meanings.definition: A unit of angular measurement equal to one sixtieth of an arcminute.
meanings.sent1: In astronomy, distances between stars are often measured in arcsec.
meanings.sent2: The telescope can detect objects as small as one arcsec in size.
meanings.sent3: The alien spaceship was only a few arcsec away from the Earth, according to the radar.
meanings.sent4: The precision of the laser beam was so high that it could split a hair into arcsec.
meanings.sent5: The tiny insect's movement was so minuscule, it could only be seen in arcsec increments.

meanings.definition: The reciprocal of the cosine of an angle, equal to the length of the hypotenuse divided by the length of the adjacent side.
meanings.sent1: Calculating the arcsec of a right triangle involves trigonometry.
meanings.sent2: The arcsec of the angle was crucial in determining the tension in the cable.
meanings.sent3: The cat's curiosity led it to investigate the arcsec of the mysterious box.
meanings.sent4: The relationship between the two friends was like the arcsec of a triangle, always connected.
meanings.sent5: The architect carefully measured the arcsec of the building's foundation to ensure stability.
